title: Data Analysis in Natural Sciences
text:
Welcome
Welcome to Data Analysis in Natural Sciences: An R-Based Approach ‚Äî a comprehensive, practical guide designed for students, professionals, and researchers across the natural sciences. This book provides hands-on methods for analyzing and visualizing data using R, with real-world applications spanning ecology, forestry, agriculture, marine biology, environmental science, and beyond.






üìò About This Book



This is an open-access online textbook that teaches modern data analysis techniques using the R programming language. Whether you‚Äôre a beginner learning R for the first time or an experienced researcher looking to adopt tidyverse workflows, this book offers practical guidance with reproducible code examples.

title: Data Analysis in Natural Sciences
text:
What You‚Äôll Learn


üìä Data Analysis Fundamentals

Import, clean, and transform data

üìà Statistical Methods

üé® Data Visualization

Publication-quality graphics with ggplot2

Effective scientific communication



üåç Real-World Applications

Conservation case studies
Environmental data analysis
Reproducible research practices

title: Data Analysis in Natural Sciences
text:
Who Is This Book For?
This book is designed for anyone working with data in the natural sciences:

üéì Students ‚Äî Undergraduate and postgraduate students in biology, ecology, forestry, agriculture, and environmental sciences
üî¨ Researchers ‚Äî Scientists seeking to enhance their data analysis and visualization skills
üåø Practitioners ‚Äî Conservation professionals, environmental consultants, and natural resource managers
üìä Data Enthusiasts ‚Äî Anyone interested in learning R for scientific data analysis







Getting Started



New to R? Start with Chapter 1: Introduction to Data Analysis for installation instructions and your first steps with R and RStudio.

title: Data Analysis in Natural Sciences
text:
Features
‚úÖ Complete code examples ‚Äî All code is fully reproducible ‚úÖ Real datasets ‚Äî Learn with actual data from ecological and environmental research ‚úÖ Modern R practices ‚Äî Tidyverse and tidymodels workflows throughout ‚úÖ Professional tips ‚Äî Best practices from experienced researchers ‚úÖ Exercises ‚Äî Practice problems to reinforce learning ‚úÖ Open access ‚Äî Free to read online

title: Data Analysis in Natural Sciences
text:
About the Author
Jimmy Moses is a Papua New Guinean entomologist and lecturer at the Papua New Guinea University of Technology‚Äôs School of Forestry. He specializes in ant ecology, biostatistics, and geospatial analysis, with a Ph.D.¬†in Entomology from the University of South Bohemia (2021).
His research combines ecological field studies with modern analytical approaches, resulting in publications in journals including Global Ecology and Biogeography and Proceedings of the Royal Society B. His passion for making complex analytical methods accessible drives both his teaching and this book.

title: Data Analysis in Natural Sciences
text:
How to Use This Book


üìñ Read Online
Browse chapters directly in your web browser. Use the navigation menu to move between sections.


üíª Run the Code
Copy code examples into R or RStudio. All code is designed to be reproducible with the included datasets.


üîß Adapt & Apply
Modify examples for your own data and research questions. The techniques are broadly applicable.

title: Data Analysis in Natural Sciences
text:
Prerequisites
To get the most out of this book, you should have:

Basic computer skills
R and RStudio installed (instructions in Chapter 1)
Curiosity about data and natural sciences!

No prior programming experience is required ‚Äî I start from the basics and build up progressively.
